ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Serious Skill question for all
ygData.msgSnippet: Trade skills are very useful. In fact they are required in order to do some of the quests. With more advanced tailoring skills, you can make a 10 slot 10%
ygData.messageBody:
Trade skills are very useful. In fact they are required in order to do some
of the quests. With more advanced tailoring skills, you can make a 10 slot
10% weight reduction bag that sells for 100pp. It's not profitable at lower
lvls but the higher lvl you get the more profitable it gets (albeit more
expensive). Right now I'm trying to get my tailoring up to do the 5th
coldain shawl quest. I need to have really good tailoring skill to sew the
shawl.
luv,
-Su

> Hi Everyone,
> I have been on this board and playing since January.
> So YES I am a newbie.
> I have three chars between 10 and 20 in level. My
> question is this.
>
> "Are the trade skills really good and do they play a
> part of succeeding at higher levels?"
> Here is why I ask. My friend is a level 17 druid and
> a tailor. He can't make armor that my level 13 Ranger
> can use that is worthwhile to me. I bought some mail
> boots and chest armor, which are far better than what
> he can make.
>
> I am also doing pottery with my Druid and I can't see
> any value to this trade. If I make 30 muffin tins, is
> some baker really going to buy the lot off me?
>
> I feel that as I get up in level, I will be able to
> get better Drop items than I can make.
> However, I do know that trades take part in some
> quests and this is the only purpose I can see for
> them. I think
>
> Am I missing something here?
>
> Trade confused!
>
>
>
